item.title: F1 25 PC Specs Revealed – RTX 5080 for Path Tracing at 1080P@60FPS
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/f1-25-pc-specs-revealed-rtx-5080-for-path-tracing-at-1080p60fps/

Today, Codemasters and EA Sports have unveiled several details of their upcoming racing game F1 25. The most interesting one for our readers is undoubtedly the detailed list of PC requirements, with recommendations for every target, including Virtual Reality, 8K resolution, or path tracing.

According to the developers, F1 25 will require a GeForce RTX 5080 or AMD RX 7900 XTX graphics card to play at 1080p resolution and 60 frames per second with upscalers (presumably NVIDIA DLSS Super Resolution and AMD FidelityFX Super Resolution, respectively) set to Quality. Weirdly enough, while the 8K spec does recommend using Frame Generation, the path tracing spec does not. Perhaps, with Frame Generation enabled, the recommended spec can actually reach 4K@60 frames per second.

Experience High Definition        // Virtual Reality Performance Quality 8K UHD Path Tracing
Target 1080p@60FPS       // 2K/Eye @90fps 1440p @144fps 4K @60fps 8K @60fps 1080p@60fps
Preset Low High High High Ultra High Ultra High Ultra Max
Intel CPU Core i5-6400 Core i5-9600k N/A Core i5-12600k Core i5-10600k Core i5-12600k Core i5-12600k
AMD CPU Ryzen 3 1200 Ryzen 5 2600X Ryzen 5 2600X Ryzen 5 7600X Ryzen 5 5600X Ryzen 5 7600X Ryzen 5 7600X
NVIDIA GeForce GPU GTX 1060 RTX 2070 / RTX 5060 RTX 3080 Ti / RTX 5080 RTX 3080 / RTX 50701 Ti RTX 3080 Ti RTX 5080 RTX 4090 / RTX 5090 RTX 4080 SUPER / RTX 5080
AMD GPU RX 570 RX 6600 XT RX 7900 XT RX 6800 XT RX 7900 XTX N/A RX 7900XTX
Intel GPU Arc A380* Arc A750* N/A Arc B580* Arc B580* N/A N/A
VRAM 6 GB 8 GB GB 12 GB 16 GB 24 GB 16 GB
RAM Notes: 8 GB *ReBAR *3200MT/s RAM 16 GB *ReBAR *3200MT/s RAM 16 GB 16 GB A *ReBAR *3200MT/s RAM A DDR5 RAM 16 GB *ReBAR *3200MT/s RAM 32 GB 16 GB
Resolution 1920x1080 1920x1080 2K/Eye 2560x1440 3840x2160 7680x4320 1920x1080
Upscalers & Frame Generation Native Native Native Native Quality Balanced + FG Quality
Ray Tracing Off Off Off Off On On Path Tracer

We also got the official F1 25 launch times and soundtrack details. Check them out below.

  • 17:00 CEST - Berlin
  • 23:00 CST - Beijing

May 28th:

  • 00:00 JST - Tokyo
  • 01:00 AEST - Sydney

item.title: Space Marine 2 Modding Is About to Get Much Bigger Thanks to Official Release of Dev Tool
item.content:encoded:
https://wccftech.com/space-marine-2-modding-is-about-to-get-much-bigger-thanks-to-official-release-of-dev-tool/

The modding scene of Warhammer 40K Space Marine 2 on PC is thriving, to say the least, with a dedicated community that even somehow managed to expand the PvE Operations mode to support up to 12 players, as if it were an MMO-like raid.

Now, though, the developers from Saber Interactive have opened the door to much bigger and deeper tweaks and improvements to the game with the release of their internal development tool, the Integration Studio. The tool can be downloaded from the Space Marine 2 Modding Hub Discord channel and weighs less than 50 MB. Here's what Space Marine 2 Game Director Dmitry Grigorenko said in the announcement:

This is the exact same editor we use internally for all gameplay development. No more editing files in Notepad and praying you didn’t miss a bracket — Integration Studio makes editing anything SSL-related ten times faster, safer, and more intuitive.

With this first release, you’ll be able to work with:
• Level scenarios
• Game modes
• Individual blueprints — and even write your own gameplay logic
• AI Behavior Trees (work in progress)
• The AI Director
• Abilities and melee combo logic
• VFX editing — now 100x easier
• UI and HUD elements
• …and more to come

And this is only the beginning.

Not long ago, I promised we would support the modding scene — and we meant it. Watching this community grow, push boundaries, and create incredible experiences has been both inspiring and humbling. We’re excited to see what you build next — whether it’s a cinematic campaign, wild new game mode, or something we never saw coming.

Warhammer 40K Space Marine 2 has been a smashing success for Saber Interactive, selling over five million units in around three months on the market. It was so successful that they already announced Space Marine 3, although there's still a meaty content roadmap planned for the current game, and the release of the modding tools will undoubtedly improve the game's longevity for PC users.
